intro: Sarcoglottis, commonly known as the arrowleaf arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive inflorescence that resembles an arrowhead. The plant is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. Sarcoglottis species typically grow in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in humid forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
